thread.title: Esther Ohwoka is Miss Safety International
thread.title_full: Esther Ohwoka is Miss Safety International

author: Okogba
title: Esther Ohwoka is Miss Safety International
text:
Home » Entertainment » Esther Ohwoka is Miss Safety International Esther Ohwoka is Miss Safety International On 5:24 am In Entertainment by Okogba Comments 
Drop dead gorgeous Esther Ohwoka has emerged as Miss Safety International 2017 in force contest that saw her beating over twelve other beauties to clinch the highly coveted crown. 
In line with the exclusive practice of the pageantry, five other queens were crowned. They are: Goodness Eneyin, Miss Safety Africa; Odia Joy, Miss Safety Nigeria; Success Emeruche, Miss Safety Tourism; Ayobami, Miss Safety Lagos and Mercy Micheal. •Esther Ohwoka and other queens, with one of the organisers 
An elated Esther Owhoka expressed gratitude to God for her victory and thanked the organizers for the opportunity. 
CEO of Kraftman Production organizers of the pageant Madu C. Chikwendu and the founder thanked the guests for coming and more importantly the contestants for their courage and confidence. 
“This pageant was founded to contribute significantly to issues of safety. The queens are the brand ambassadors on issues of safety and they are expected to be the voice for safety”. 
Founded in 2012 by the Filmmaker Madu C Chikwendu, the pageant has been specially engineered as his contribution to raising awareness about issues of safety with the catch phrase ”beauty for safety”. 
The queen will reign for eight calendar months with the ‘Coronation’ Ball for the 2018 edition taking place in February. Okogba
